paper_title.en: Hydroxyapatite-bound cationic ruthenium complexes as novel heterogeneous Lewis acid catalysts for Diels-Alder and aldol reactions

description.en: Creation of a stable and well-defined active center on a solid surface is a promising protocol for designing more efficient hybrid-catalysts that bridge the gap between homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis. Treatment of a hydroxyapatite-bound Ru complex (RuHAP) with an aqueous solution of AgX (X = SbF6-, TfO-) afforded a new type of cationic Ru phosphate complex, having potentially vacant coordination sites. These cationic RuHAPs exhibited Lewis acidity toward carbonyl and cyano groups, promoting Diels-Alder and Aldol reactions with high efficiencies. Moreover, no Ru leaching was detected in the above organic reactions, and then the catalysts were recyclable. Copyright © 2003 American Chemical Society.

publication_name.en: Journal of the American Chemical Society

paper_title.en: A novel montmorilionite-enwrapped scandium as a heterogeneous catalyst for Michael reaction

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY

paper_title.en: Self-assembled Dendrimer-bound Pd(II) Complexes via Acid-base Interactions and their Catalysis for Allylic Amination

description.en: The Pd complexes were noncovalently attached on the periphery of poly(propyleneimine) dendrimers based on acid-base interactions. The dendritic Pd complexes were found to possess catalytic activities for allylic amination, and to be able to mimick the catalytic activity of the analogous monomeric Pd complex catalyst.

paper_title.en: Highly efficient dehydrogenation of indolines to indoles using hydroxyapatite-bound Pd catalyst

description.en: A hydroxyapatite-bound palladium catalyst was found to be effective for the dehydrogenation of various types of indolines to give the corresponding indoles. Moreover, the catalyst was readily recovered from the reaction mixture, and could be reused without any loss of its catalytic activity. (C) 2003 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Self-Assembled Dendrimer-Bound Pd(Ⅱ)Complexes via Acid-Base Interactions and Their Catalysis for Allylic Amination
paper_title.en: Self-assembled dendrimer-bound Pd(II) complexes via acid-base interactions and their catalysis for allylic Amination

description.en: The Pd complexes were noncovalently attached on the periphery of poly(propyleneimine) dendrimers based on acid-base interactions. The dendritic Pd complexes were found to possess catalytic activities for allylic amination, and to be able to mimick the catalytic activity of the analogous monomeric Pd complex catalyst.

paper_title.en: Highly efficient deprotection of acetals by titanium cation-exchanged montmorillonite as a strong solid acid catalyst

description.en: Deprotection of various kinds of acetals sufficiently occured in the presence of Ti4+-exchanged montmorillonite as a recyclable strong solid acid catalyst.

paper_title.en: Efficient deprotection of N-benzyloxycarbonyl group from amino acids by hydroxyapatite-bound Pd catalyst in the presence of molecular hydrogen

description.en: Hydroxyapatite-bound Pd catalyst was found to be highly effective for the deprotection of N-benzyloxycarbonyl group from amino acids in the presence of molecular hydrogen. The catalyst was also applicable to the hydrogenolysis of a sterically encumbered core-Z-protected poly(amido amine) dendrimer, affording the dendritic amino compound in 99% yield. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: A Novel Montmorillonite-Enwrapped Scandium as a Hetergeneous Catalyst for Michael Reaction

publication_name.ja: Journal of the American Chemical Society

paper_title.en: Oxidation of benzyl alcohol aiming at a greener reaction

description.en: A highly efficient heterogeneous catalyst Ru-Mn-Fe-Cu-O successfully oxidized benzyl alcohol to benzaldehyde in the presence of oxygen using toluene or water as solvent, and without solvent aiming at greener chemistry.

paper_title.ja: Nanoscale Palladium cluster lmmobilized on a Tio2 Surface as an Effisient Catalyst for the Lignid-Phase Wacker Oxidition of Higher Terminal Olefins
paper_title.en: Nanoscale Palladium Cluster Immobilized on a TiO_2 Surface as an Efficient Catalyst for Liquid-phase Wacker Oxidation of Higher Terminal Olefins
Highly selective oxidation of allylic alcohols catalysed by monodispersed 8-shell Pd nanoclusters in the presence of molecular oxygen

description.en: Treatment of Pd(4)phen(2) (CO)(2) (OAc)(4) with metal nitrates such as Cu(NO3)(2) produced monodispersed Pd nanoclusters with a mean diameter and standard deviation (d +/- sigma) of 38 +/- 2.1 Angstrom (sigma/d = 6%). The Pd nanoclusters act as heterogeneous catalysts for the selective oxidation of primary aromatic allylic alcohols using molecular oxygen as an oxidant. This unique catalysis can be ascribed to multiple interactions between the alcohol and specific ensemble sites consisting of Pd-0, Pd+, and Pd2+ on the cluster surface.

Efficient heterogeneous oxidation of organosilanes to silanols catalysed by a hydroxyapatite-bound Ru complex in the presence of water and molecular oxygen

description.en: RuHAP is a highly selective and reusable catalyst for the oxidation of a wide variety of organosilanes to the corresponding silanols in the presence of water and molecular oxygen.

paper_title.en: Environmentally friendly alcohol oxidation using heterogeneous catalyst in the presence of air at room temperature

description.en: Various types of alcohols oxidation can be achieved using air as a sole oxidant at room temperature without any other additives. From the results of Ru K-edge XAFS and XPS characterizations, MnFe1.5Ru0.35Cu0.15O4 catalyst with possibly coordinatively unsaturation of the isolated Ru=O species as active sites is an efficient heterogeneous catalyst and can be reused. Besides, the workup procedure is extremely simple. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
